column2: In  Dharmasiri  v  Republic  of  Sri  Lanka  the  Court  of  Appeal  (2010  (2)  SLR  241)

column1: Sisira de Abrew, J held inter alia;

column2: "Because the witness is a belated witness, Court ought not to reject his testimony

column1: on that score alone. Court must inquire into the reason for the delay and if the reason for
the delay  is  plausible  and  justifiable  the  Court  could  ad on the evidence  of the  belated
witness."

column2: It is clear that the reason for PW1’s delay in implicating the accused was due to

column1: the  fear  of  his  own  safety.  This  court  accepts  the  reason  for  delaying  which  is
justifiable. Therefore this court could act on the evidence of the belated witness.
